;

;Southern Weekend reporters randomly interviewed many "bald young men" with pathological hair loss. It is believed that staying up late, anxiety and chronic stress are important contributors to hair loss. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;The first severe hair loss started from the top of the head.

;

;A wide slit opens in the middle of the head, and gradually spreads to the left and right sides, turning into an oval. A large area of ​​scalp is exposed, and then spreads uncontrollably. The hair in other places begins to become soft and yellow. , in the end, the hair is like a mature dandelion, falling off with the slightest touch.

;

;"As long as you sit down for a while, you will find that there are fallen hairs on the chair, arms, and clothes." Greedy said. Eight years ago, 20-year-old Gretchen started her own business overseas. In the three months before the trial opening of the store, she was in a high-pressure state of mental stress and physical exhaustion every day. McDonald's at three in the morning became her most frequent restaurant. .

;

;Hair loss is the trace left on her body by this day and night hard work. As a daily lingo among young people, "bald-headed" is not only a description of appearance, but also a state of exhaustion in work and life.

;

;25-35 years old, male, working in the IT industry, these three labels delineate the target group of hair transplant customers that Wang Xiaoping, director of Damai Microneedle Hair Transplantation Technology Research Institute, has the most contact with. According to CCTV News, a survey on people with hair loss released by the National Health Commission showed that the number of people with hair loss in my country has exceeded 250 million.

;

;“The high pressure and fast pace of modern life have promoted the trend of younger hair loss from the environmental level. Taking common androgenic alopecia as an example, high mental stress, staying up late, and excessive exercise may all lead to Increased androgen levels will have a negative impact on hair follicles, leading to progressive miniaturization of hair follicles, which is manifested as hair gradually becoming thinner, softer or even falling off." Liu Yi, deputy chief physician at the Dermatology Hospital of the Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences, told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;;"Stress and staying up late ;; are ;;directly reflected on the hair" ;

;

;After 35 years old Having just joined a pharmaceutical company as a sales assistant, "older newcomer" Fan Fan felt that everything was too difficult. One person is responsible for various data statistics and administrative management of a sales team of more than 100 people. She works overtime until late at night every day. When she was infected with the new coronavirus for the first time, she only took less than a day's rest before continuing to work.

;

;Fan Fan doesn’t dare to make mistakes, but no one is willing to spend time teaching him. The huge workload led to frequent mistakes, which often caused her to be stared at and scolded loudly. She did not dare to bring negative emotions to the workplace, "for fear of being unemployed again at this age." In the end, all the anger was reserved for the family - "I will yell at the child even if she calls her mother."

;

;In February 2023, 37-year-old Fan Fan decided to resign naked. Two months later, her hairdresser informed her that she had alopecia areata on the top of her head. "Long-term bad mood, insomnia, panic, and gastroenteritis made me realize that I had a serious problem. I decided to resign under the pressure of difficulty in re-employment. However, I soon fell into the anxiety of being unemployed again. I didn't expect that I would be unemployed again. Encountered alopecia areata." Fan Fan said.

;

;According to the "China Alopecia Areata Diagnosis and Treatment Guidelines (2019)" issued by the Chinese Medical Association, alopecia areata is a hair follicle-specific autoimmune disease caused by the combined effect of genetic factors and environmental factors, which is manifested by the sudden onset of clear-cut borders on the scalp. circular patchy hair loss.

;

;In 2010, scholars such as Guo Hongwei from the Department of Dermatology at the Southwest Hospital of the Third Military Medical University investigated the correlation between stressful life events and the risk of alopecia areata. The study showed that mental stress plays a significant role in the onset of alopecia areata. , sleep changes are the most dangerous factor.

;

;Many "bald young men" who suffered from pathological hair loss randomly interviewed by Southern Weekend reporters all believed that staying up late, anxiety and chronic stress were important contributors to their hair loss. At a deeper level, it may be explained by the contemporary German philosopher Han Bingzhe's description of modern society as a "merit society" - people willingly fall into self-exploitation in a highly competitive environment and are exhausted in their efforts to realize their own value.

;

;Zhu Yu, who loves to play "Honor of Kings", "particularly cares about winning or losing the game." After losing, he always wants to wait until he wins before the game ends. He stays up until four or five in the morning to fall asleep almost every day; designer Jiao Jiao She often goes to bed at three o'clock in the middle of the night. When interviewed by a Southern Weekend reporter, she could not fall asleep until five or six o'clock in the morning for a month. Aric, a software engineer, encounters unsolvable problems at work and becomes anxious and nervous to the point of insomnia. According to his observation, nearly half of the programmers around him are suffering from hair loss.

;

;When she suffered massive hair loss, 24-year-old Tian Luo was the store manager of a real estate agency store in Shanghai. Her daily working hours were from 9 a.m. to 1 a.m. the next day, with six days off and one day off. Even on her only day off, Tian Luo couldn't truly rest as she had to deal with customer complaints and other work at any time.

;

;In the year of graduation, Tian Luo came to the "dream Shanghai" from Yunnan, won the first place in regional sales performance from scratch, and was promoted to manager in two years. But like countless young people who feel confused in their struggle, Tian Luo suddenly felt that she had lost her sensitivity to everything around her. "I only had work, performance pressure and staying up late in my eyes, which were directly reflected in my hair."

;

;;"If I just met you;; and I;;are bald;;, I;;can’t choose you. As the other half";

;

;The adolescence Chan Chan had shoulder-length hair. Since she started losing her hair, she has cut her hair shorter and shorter, keeping it above the chin all year round. She also lost 10 hairs, and long hair would visually cause a greater psychological burden on her.

;

;Because of hair loss, the 1.65-meter-tall Grean Chan habitually walks at the highest point in the group. "If you stand on the escalator first (when the elevator goes down) or stand on a lower step, and the people next to you can see the top of your head, I will try to stand behind you and stand higher than others.";

;Medically, hair loss is usually divided into seven levels. Level 7 is the most severe severe hair loss, and Greedy was diagnosed with level 6. "At that time, it was impossible to socialize at all. Whether I saw a rainbow, a shooting star, or any other occasion where I could make a wish, I would sincerely pray. My birthday wish every year is to make my hair grow back."

;

;He Severe Along with the hair loss came a diagnosis of depression and anxiety. In his early twenties, Greedy often thought: What is so precious about youth? I'd better live to be fifty as soon as possible, so that when others my age start to go bald, I won't look different from others.

;

;Ganchan and her boyfriend met in their freshman year. She was glad that her hair was not as thick as her scalp at that time. Although the other party never expressed concern about hair to Greedy, once, her boyfriend admitted, "If you were like you are now (bald) when we first met, I really wouldn't be able to choose you as my other partner." half".

;

;When he is most emotionally depressed, Greedy will blame all his unsatisfactory life and work on his hair loss. Sometimes I quarrel with my boyfriend, and I can't help but think to myself, "If I had hair and wasn't as ugly as I am now, maybe he wouldn't quarrel with me."

;

;The "Mobius strip" of interaction between body and mind may help us better understand the relationship between hair loss and stress.

;

;The diseases that negative emotions bring to the body are called psychosomatic diseases in the medical field - physical and organic diseases in which psychosocial factors play an important role in the onset and development. If the internal genetic factors causing hair loss are regarded as bullets, anxiety and internal friction are like triggers, which are important triggers that promote and aggravate the phenomenon of hair loss.

;

;Physical illness in turn aggravates negative emotions, which can be called a physical and mental reaction, that is, physical illness becomes a psychological stressor and affects mental health.

;

;“There is an interaction between physical health and mental health. This is because the human body’s nervous system, endocrine system and immune system interact with each other to jointly maintain the stability of the body’s internal environment. This interaction is a physiological and An important research area in the medical field is called the bio-psycho-social model. Many disfiguring skin diseases may cause patients to have anxiety, depression or self-esteem problems, which may lead to immune regulation disorders and further aggravate physical diseases." Liu Yi said .

;

;A survey on anxiety and depression in patients with common psychosomatic skin diseases, published in "Journal of Southeast University (Medical Edition)", showed that 17% of patients with skin diseases have psychological disorders that co-occur with their skin diseases. question.

;

;Cui Shaofang, executive director and deputy CEO of Damai Hair Transplant Medical Group, told Southern Weekend reporters that the post-90s generation, who have become the main force in hair loss, often suffer from low self-esteem due to hair loss, which affects work and spouse selection. “Many people seeking hair transplant treatment The real desire of patients with hair loss is to build self-confidence, which prompts us to pay more attention to the mental health of people with hair loss."

;

;;"I'm afraid that after I stop taking the medicine, ;;the hair that grew out before will also ;; fall out";

;

;September 24, 2023, is the 378th day that Lan Pingping insists on using minoxidil. In more than a year, she experienced three "crazy hair loss periods". Each time she washed her hair, she lost one to two hundred strands, which lasted about 20 days.

;

;After long-term use of minoxidil, Lan Pingping found that her whole body had become hirsutious, and her scalp also had acne from time to time, but she never thought about stopping. The hair that came out also fell out.”

;

;In interviews with reporters from Southern Weekend, almost all hair loss patients admitted that they have used common anti-hair loss products on the market, including but not limited to anti-hair loss shampoos, laser hair growth caps, scalp essences, massage combs, and five-part anti-hair loss products. Black powder, black sesame balls, etc. Among them, the most commonly mentioned is minoxidil hair growth solution administered as an over-the-counter drug.

;

;Minoxidil was originally a drug used to treat high blood pressure, but was accidentally discovered to promote hair growth. Liu Yi believes that there is some abuse of minoxidil due to promotion by e-commerce platforms and self-media. Although minoxidil is relatively safe, it may also cause some side effects, such as local allergies or irritation reactions, hirsutism, etc., and in a few cases, it may even cause a drop in blood pressure, tachycardia, etc. Therefore, its application is best carried out under the guidance of a doctor to avoid abuse and overdose to ensure safety and effectiveness.

;

;"First, minoxidil is a therapeutic drug, and it is not necessary to use it for the purpose of preventing hair loss when hair loss does not occur; second, although androgenic alopecia is the main cause of hair loss, Causes, but telogen effluvium, alopecia areata, etc. are also very common, and some patients may be accompanied by other underlying diseases, so the type of hair loss should be judged by a doctor before treatment. For example, diffuse alopecia areata, the clinical manifestations can be similar to androgenic alopecia, but used alone Minoxidil is usually not very effective," Liu Yi said.

;

;After a long illness, Greanman often reads research papers in the field of hair loss and thinks he has tried almost every anti-hair loss product on the market. She has bought five to six thousand yuan of supplements from domestic micro-businessmen that claim to "radically cure hair loss", and has also spent 10,000 yuan to buy imported 650 nanometer laser hair caps.

;

;In her opinion, some high-priced products actually have low raw materials and are just an "IQ tax" labeled "anti-hair loss". Most products have limited help in hair growth, and it is difficult to produce visible hair loss when used alone. Visible hair growth effects.

;

;According to the "Cosmetics Supervision and Administration Regulations" that will be implemented in 2021, the original hair growth cosmetics category will be cancelled. Hair growth cosmetics that have obtained the "National Cosmetic Special Label" in the past will be classified as "hair growth cosmetics" after a five-year transition period. Stop production and sales. Newly added anti-hair loss cosmetics are registered and managed as "special purpose cosmetics" and require efficacy testing at a cosmetics administrative licensing inspection agency. They can be produced and sold only after approval by the State Food and Drug Administration.

;

;Liu Yi believes that the popularity of anti-hair loss products shows that the current hair loss problem still faces huge unmet clinical needs. "For androgenic alopecia, the most common type of hair loss, currently only two drugs, finasteride and minoxidil, are approved for treatment in China. However, some patients have poor efficacy, coupled with safety concerns and other factors, Therefore, there is a demand for alternative methods in the market."

;

;;"Build your own combination boxing";

;

;In 2021, Greedy decided to finally fight for Shengfa She tried her best once, and if she failed again, she decided to let herself go. "I can't continue to struggle in the whirlpool of hair loss. Even if I have no hair and wear a wig all my life, I still want to be a happy little girl."

;

;Gantan listed the experience he gained from seeking medical treatment for seven years, and created a set of "hair growth combination boxing" methods that cover washing and care steps, medication combination, dietary structure, and work and rest adjustments. Looking back, Greedy thinks that was the moment when "the gears of his destiny began to turn."

;

;"When I completely relaxed my mood, adjusted my lifestyle, and followed my DIY method for two months, my scalp began to be covered with new hair, and my hair grew back again." Speaking of this "Miracle", Greedy still finds it incredible.

;

;In this set of combos, Greedy insists on completing at least two of the three things "eat well, sleep well, feel good" every day. She made a video of her experience and shared it on the Internet, which received tens of thousands of likes. Greanman discovered that she was not the only one suffering from hair loss.

;

;In fact, once alopecia is diagnosed, it is likely that you will need to fight it for life. Waiting for the emergence of new technologies and reconciling with oneself have become life issues for "bald young people".

;

;Fu Hongbo, a 22-year-old senior in college, was diagnosed with androgenic alopecia. After using minoxidil for nearly a year with no obvious results, he chose to go to a hair transplant institution for forehead transplantation. To his surprise, the forehead after hair transplantation was still visibly sparse, accompanied by a large amount of shedding.

;

;Tu Ming, dean of Yonghe’s hair transplant business, told Southern Weekend reporters that the principle of hair transplantation is to transplant healthy hair follicles from the occipital area of ​​the body to areas with sparse hair. It is mainly used in androgenic alopecia. With current technical means, androgenic alopecia cannot be cured. Therefore, hair transplantation can improve the current aesthetic problem, but it does not mean that hair loss can be stopped after hair transplantation. Controlling hair loss to a more satisfactory level requires long-term medication and maintenance. treat.

;

;Looking at the slightly M-angled hairline of his newborn son, Aric worried that his M-shaped hair loss would be passed on to the next generation. Fu Hongbo's way of explaining his explanation is "I believe in the development of science and technology. Maybe hair follicle cloning technology will appear in a few years to completely solve this problem."

;

;The medical community never stops working hard. In June 2023, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approved Pfizer's new drug Ritlecitinib for the treatment of alopecia areata in adolescents and adults aged 12 years and older. Ritexitinib becomes the first drug approved to treat adolescents with alopecia areata.

;

;“Compared with baricitinib, the first treatment for severe alopecia areata in adults approved in China, ritexitinib has a stronger targeting effect on the autoimmune inflammatory pathways related to alopecia areata. It is safer and more effective, bringing new breakthroughs in the treatment of alopecia areata," Liu Yi said.

;

;Now, Greedy is a "hair growth blogger" with 100,000 followers on social media. There are always people leaving private messages, asking her to recommend a product that is most helpful for hair growth. Gretchen replies over and over again: "Don't believe that any product can cure your hair loss. The only way is to start by changing your lifestyle." , build your own combination punch."

;

;As a brand manager engaged in marketing and product development, Mei Lan was diagnosed with diffuse alopecia areata in June 2022. After experiencing hair loss for half a year, Mei Lan seemed to have been reborn. "No matter how busy you are at work, you still have to exercise every day. People always have to give themselves some space. When life is no longer limited to one branch, I naturally no longer care about the gains and losses on this road, because I will have many branches.";

;It is not easy to make peace with yourself and hair loss. Her hair is like a greedy experimental field. She keeps sowing seeds on it. Sometimes the harvest is poor and sometimes it is abundant. Even if she has a set of "combination punches" to deal with it, sometimes a mood swing is enough to destroy all the hard work and she has to start from scratch. came. But the good news is that as long as you continue to maintain a good attitude and living habits, everything will happily get better.

;

;Glutton never broke up with her boyfriend of nine years. They got married in 2023. When looking back on this relationship, she wrote -

;

;"Actually, whether you are bald or not, It does not hinder true love and being loved."
